reviewText: I've only been line dancing for a couple of months and I'm having a blast.  I take 2 classes a week, so I'm going at a pretty good pace.  I bought his DVD's so I could work on dancing on the days when I'm not taking a class.  And most of these (not all) are already a review for me.  BUT I must say that some of his explainations for some of the steps involved are MUCH better than I've heard before.  He gives great instructions and shows more than once how to do the dance.  I love ethe picture in a picture in the lessons.  I only wish I could take some real lessons from him, I bet that would be a blast!Now as far as the music goes, some folks will be dissapointed that he doesn't actually use the music that one would normally use to dance the dances he teaches.  I'm going to make a wild guess and say that it would be very expensive for him to get a license for each of the dances and would make the cost of the DVD go way up.  I can live with the music he provides.  I do wish that he'd make a point of telling us on each dance what music is usually used for that dance, he did that a time or two, but I don't think with each dance.I would recommend his DVD's to anyone, I think that anyone could pop this DVD into their player and be dancing before more than an hour was up!  He'a a good teacher for sure.
summary: Great way to brush up or learn to line dance
Title: Line Dance 101: A Quick Start Guide to Line Dancing

reviewText: Shawn Trautman's instruction DVD is excellent.  He goes through the steps from more than one angle and explains very well.  Also repeats enough to help the total beginner, which I am.  Highly recommend for newbies to line dancing.
summary: The best instructional DVD for line dancing I've seen
Title: Line Dance 101: A Quick Start Guide to Line Dancing

reviewText: A great beginning, easy to follow video for line dancing.  Once you master it you can move on to higher level DVD.  This is great for someone who really needs the basics broken down.
Title: Line Dance 101: A Quick Start Guide to Line Dancing

reviewText: I bought this to give to a female friend who wanted to learn line dancing.  She found it helpful to learn the steps of the Electric Slide used locally.
Title: Line Dance 101: A Quick Start Guide to Line Dancing

reviewText: it is a good beginners dvd. It's easy to follow and Shawn Trautman takes time to show you steps from different angles.
Title: Line Dance 101: A Quick Start Guide to Line Dancing

reviewText: If your are new to line-dancing and don't know where to start, this is the DVD for you.  After practicing with this DVD, I was able to feel right dancing at the Saddle Rack in Fremont, CA.  This is the place to start if you want to get into country dancing.
Title: Line Dance 101: A Quick Start Guide to Line Dancing

reviewText: I just finished learning the entire DVD of dances and variations and I must say throughout Shawn is an excellent instructor giving back and side views of the moves and dances so you don't have to reverse what you're doing but can move naturally with him. Also, unlike what the most negative reviewer said - you certainly do get to dance every dance to at least a 2 minute piece of music, not including the "prelude" before (doing it without music) and build up he does throughout the entire teaching linking recently learnt moves to the building dance. There is also a Full Review section for doing all the dances and moves in a more aerobic style session and the practice for the last dance "Slappin' Leather" is included after that session rather than in the end of it's section (unlike the rest). An excellent instructor and awesome country line dancing with easy and some impressive advanced variations and pieces. 5 stars!
summary: One of the best instructors ever!
Title: Line Dance 101: A Quick Start Guide to Line Dancing

reviewText: You get very basic lessons on five kinds of line dances and I would value this DVD at about $12.  If they would have added a dance session for every kind of dance, I would have felt like I got my money's worth.  By dance session, I mean that they could have videoed people actually using the steps so you could dance along.  Also, the music used was jazzy instead of country - what's up with that?
Title: Line Dance 101: A Quick Start Guide to Line Dancing

reviewText: I am very glad I ordered this DVD.  For so long time I wanted learn electric slide, trying to copy people who "knew" how to. Now I will know how to dance it and will dance steps the right way.DVD lessons are very easy to follow. Just foot detail could be a little bit larger. But it's OK.Thank you Shawn.
Title: Line Dance 101: A Quick Start Guide to Line Dancing
